page.title: 12FARMING AND THE COMMUNITY
page.content: The farmer at{Chalk Farm}often does straw-baling for other people as there has been a lot of public concern about setting fire to the waste straw after combining. He sells the straw as animal bedding, often to the racing stables at Newmarket, but sometimes to far-away areas such as Wales. There is not a very regular market for straw. Some of the harvest from each year's crop is kept for seed. Other seed is bought from a local merchant at Swaffham Bulbeck who also buys in some of the farm's produce. The farm also buys fertilisers, diesel fuel, wire and string.
